error_description: Direct string concatenation in native SQL query enables SQL injection vulnerability, allowing arbitrary database access and data exfiltration (Security: injection, Confidentiality, Integrity)

Redundant instantiation of BCryptPasswordEncoder inside service method creates new encoder per operation, breaking password verification consistency and enabling auth bypass (Security: Authenticity, Integrity)

Double-hashing password in update mapper expression (passwordEncoder.encode(passwordEncoder.encode(...))) corrupts password storage, causing all future logins to fail (Security: Integrity, Authenticity)
Unwrapped .get() on Optional from repository without null check causes NullPointerException crash when address not found, violating fault tolerance (Reliability: Fault tolerance, Availability)

Unwrapped .get() on Optional from repository without null check causes NullPointerException crash when address not found during update, violating fault tolerance (Reliability: Fault tolerance, Availability)

Unwrapped .get() on Optional from repository without null check causes NullPointerException crash when address not found during delete, violating fault tolerance (Reliability: Fault tolerance, Availability)

Unwrapped .get() on Optional from findByUsername without null check causes NullPointerException crash when user not found during login, breaking authentication availability (Reliability: Availability, Fault tolerance)

Placeholder field 'someValue' with misleading validation messages violates naming and functional correctness, causing client confusion and data mapping errors (Maintainability: Analysability, Usability: Learnability)

Incorrect mapping of 'someValue' to 'street' creates data inconsistency between DTO and entity, leading to lost address data in persistence (Functional suitability: Functional correctness, Maintainability: Modularity)
Incorrect update mapping of 'someValue' to 'street' perpetuates data inconsistency during partial updates, causing silent data corruption (Reliability: Faultlessness, Integrity)

Manual pagination implementation ignores Spring Data's Pageable sorting and ignores actual repository paging, returning incorrect or incomplete results (Functional suitability: Functional completeness, Compatibility: Interoperability)
Missing @PreAuthorize on delete endpoint allows unauthorized user deletion, violating access control and enabling privilege escalation (Security: Access control, Authenticity)

Mapping to new Address entity but returning response from unmapped entity causes ID mismatch in response, breaking HTTP contract consistency (Usability: User error protection, Compatibility: Co-existence)
Non-descriptive method name 'do_Some_Stuff' violates Clean Code naming principles, reducing maintainability and readability (Maintainability: Analysability, Modularity)
Field injection via @Autowired on UserRepository violates dependency injection best practices and constructor injection preference (Maintainability: Modularity, Testability)
